briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of BI 10773 as add-on to Insulin Regimen in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria:

1. Diagnosis of T2DM prior to informed consent
2. Male and female patients on diet and exercise regimen who are pre-treated with multiple daily injections (MDI) of insulin alone or in combination with immediate or extended release metformin
3. Stable metformin therapy: daily dose \>=1500 mg/day or maximum tolerated dose
4. HbA1c \>=7.5% and \<=10% at screening

Exclusion criteria:

1. Uncontrolled hyperglycemia with a glucose level \>240 mg/dl (\>13.3 mmol/L) after an overnight fast during placebo run-in
2. Any contraindications to metformin according to the local label
3. Acute coronary syndrome, stroke or TIA within 3 months prior to informed consent

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c After 18 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary endpoint was the change from baseline in HbA1c after 18 weeks of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Insulin Dose After 52 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: The secondary endpoint is change from baseline in insulin dose after 52 weeks of treatment

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Body Weight After 52 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: The secondary endpoint was the change from baseline in body weight after 52 weeks of treatment

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c After 52 Weeks of Treatment
outcomeMeasures.description: The secondary endpoint was the change from baseline in HbA1c after 52 weeks of treatment
